RequirementText: Internally to the CPN, a CNG transmitting private or other critical information (i.e. to a CND) shall protect the data from unauthorised disclosure.
Label: Security

RequirementText: Internally to the CPN, a CNG receiving private or other critical information (i.e. from a CND) should verify that the data was protected from unauthorised disclosure.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall detect the end of the life of the key used for cryptographic protection of the wireless communication between the CND and the CNG.
Label: Security

RequirementText: A CPN-user attempting to invoke a CNG-mediated service shall be identified and authenticated by the CNG before being granted access to the service.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall implement an authentication failure handling policy.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall take action according to local authentication failure handling policy (which may include silently discarding the authentication and explicit failure notification, or in the case of a replay of credentials may include notification of the true owner of the credentials) upon detection of failure during identification, authentication and authorization.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG should detect replayed user and/or device credentials.
Label: Security

RequirementText: When the CNG detects replayed user and/or device credentials, the CNG shall stop the relevant processes.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall implement a privacy protection policy specifying as a minimum private and critical information.
Label: Security

RequirementText: When the CNG detects violation of the privacy protection policy the CNG shall discard all signalling, including signalling from the NGN.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall implement an authorization management handling policy.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On reception at the CNG of a message to access configuration information for update and detection of authorization failure the CNG shall reject the request and manage the failure in accordance with the CPN authorization management handling policy.
Label: Security

RequirementText: Where a CND invokes a session at the CNG the CNG shall record the association of session-id, invoking device identity and invoking user-id.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On transmission of management information from the CNG to a CND the CNG shall append a timestamp or sequence number to the outgoing message.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On reception at the CNG of a message containing management information the CNG shall extract the timestamp or sequence number and verify that the message has not been replayed.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On reception at the CNG of a message to access or update configuration information the CNG shall allow access only if the sender is an administrator.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On detection of a message integrity error at the CNG the CNG shall discard the message.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On indication received at the CNG of a resource allocation expiry the CNG shall delete all residual data associated with the invocation of the resource.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On receipt of a valid (i.e. authorized) request for data stored in the CNG the CNG shall return the requested data to the requesting user.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On receipt of a valid (i.e. authorized) request for access to a CNG hosted service or application the CNG shall provide the requested service or application to the requesting user.
Label: Security

RequirementText: On detection of any system failure or discontinuity not specifically handled by other mechanisms the CNG shall revert to a known safe state.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate itself to the NGN for connectivity purposes.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate itself to the NGN for service usage purposes.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate CNDs to the NGN for service usage purposes if they are not able to fully support the related procedures in an autonomous way.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support mechanisms for authentication of wireless CNDs for local connectivity. Similar mechanisms may be also implemented for non-wireless devices.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG and CPN shall support mechanisms that prevent access to the network by unauthorized users.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The capacity of the authorized entities should depend on the security policies defined by the service providers, managing the CNG.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG and the CPN shall implement mechanisms to limit the visibility of the WAN side network and resources to authorized entities.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The diagnostic operations on the CPN by an operator shall be performed in accordance with rules protecting the users' privacy.
Label: Security

RequirementText: CPN environment shall be protected with a stateful firewall function, that may be implemented in the CNG.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG and the CPN shall be able to support parental control related functionalities limiting the use of the broadband connection on a user or time basis. Limitations on a content basis may be shared with devoted network servers.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall be equipped with a WAN interface towards the NGN, implementing layer 1 and 2 functionalities ("one-box" solution).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: LAN interfaces. The CNG shall be equipped with at least one Ethernet (minimum 100 Mbit/s) is interface. Optional interfaces could be present, e.g.: wireless LAN Wi-Fi Alliance certified, Powerlines, Plastic Optical Fiber, USB device and/or host, one or more FXS for analog telephony, DECT Cat-iq.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support both routed and bridged modes of operation.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support direct intra-LAN connectivity between any appropriate pair of devices on the Customer Premises Network.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support different IP address schemes and subnets on the same physical LAN port, and on different LAN ports, irrespective of routed or bridged mode of operation, allowing the direct addressability of CNDs from the NGN side in relation to data plane, control plane and management plane flows.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG and devices shall support mechanisms to identify and share information about the customer network devices (e.g. type of device and basic capabilities, services supported etc.) within the customer environment. Some of this information can be used locally, while a subset of it can be forwarded to the NGN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support use of one user identity on several terminals as well as to share one terminal with several identities.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG and the Customer Network shall support the NGN services usage (e.g. voice communications, video communications, IPTV, entertainment, …) allowing the connection to the right service control platforms.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG should support redirection of IP Multimedia sessions, as defined by TS 181 005 [1], independently from the type of device used (NGN terminal or other CND).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG and the Customer Network shall assure the confidentiality, the integrity of signalling/control/media and management flows.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG and the Customer Network shall provide the opportunity for a customer network administrator to perform service and network-related configuration. According to the service/network provider choices, the CNG and Customer Network may prevent - user initiated modification of network and service related parameters.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG should negotiate session parameters (bandwidth, screen resolution, codecs…) with the NGN transparently to the user.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CPN shall support remote access, based on NGN network functions.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall allow the customer remote access to a CND in the Customer Network, for example a surveillance video camera.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Standard NGN authentication, routing and connectivity should be used to establish remote access connectivity.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may use multiple tunnel connections for providing e.g. adequate QoS for the remote access user.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may allow secure dynamic firewall opening for remote access devices based on NGN authentication functions.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may provide Home to Home (H2H) communication service  connecting CNDs in  different CPNs.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If Home to Home (H2H) communication service is provided, then each CNG must limit access to local CNDs and/or media classes based on the access rights of the remote H2H user identity.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If Home to Home (H2H) communication service is provided, then each CNG must ensure that emergency service sessions originating in its CPN are associated with the appropriate location information and/or calling identity.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CPN may support encrypted communication with remote access devices, and the encrypted communication can be terminated either at the CNG or CND.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may act as a proxy for handling messages (requests and responses) related to the remote access scenarios to and from the home.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may support mechanisms supporting nomadism of the users and their subscribed services from one physical customer environment to another.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG should be able to assist in establishing Rich Communication Suite sessions between CNDs, including joining/splitting voice & media streams.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: It should be possible for more than one identity to be associated with a single CPN subscription.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: It should be possible for a service profile to be associated with each identity within a CPN subscription.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: It shall be possible for a single public identity to be associated with multiple CNDs where each association is allocated a unique private identity.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Multiple public identities on the same terminal shall be supported.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the support of call forking towards customer non-IMS capable devices.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall able to store information related to private identities of non-IMS capable CNDs.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the support of call forwarding toward non-IMS capable CNDs.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support intra-CPN communication between IMS and non-IMS capable CNDs.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The customer environment (CNG and/or CNDs) should support a mechanism to allow service roaming
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The NGN network should be provided with a CND location information.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Codec requirements and capabilities for the User Equipment (including the CNG) are already defined in TS 181 005 [1] which describes service requirements and capabilities for the TISPAN NGN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support mechanisms for managing IPTV flows provided both in unicast and multicast mode.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of multicast flows the CNG shall keep a record of which devices are subscribed to which multicast group.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: An IPTV media flow shall be terminated by a STB or by a specific device called "media gateway" (or "application gateway"). The CNG shall not terminate any IPTV flow by itself.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support the connection to a STB (or media gateway) both in a bridged or in a routed mode of operation.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Depending on the operation mode chosen (bridged or touted) and on the type of flow treated (unicast or multicast) the CNG shall forward packets only to the physical interfaces which are connected to devices interested to the IPTV flow.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of multicast streams the CNG should support proxy functionalities to optimize the management of information related to signalling.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CNG shall perform a link layer multicast to unicast translation if the STB or media gateway are connected using customer network technologies not supporting multicast flows (e.g. powerlines, wireless).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: STB or media gateways should be equipped with a programmable open API allowing the implementation of specific service logics.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Functionalities related to Electronic Programming Guide and DRM management shall be implemented in STB or media gateway and not in CNG.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Media flows (data plane) transcoding shall be performed by STB or media gateway and not by the CNG.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Protocols adaptation for control plane or management plane may be performed by CNG.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Presence related information shall be sent to the NGN by the STB or the CNG (depending on the specific architectural choices, CNG could manage the presence related information on behalf of the specific device used) to enable specific services tailored on the specific user's profile.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CPN should support user generated content (UGC) using  an NGN service.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CPN should support storage of UGC within the CPN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Subject to applicable regulation, UGC media streams may be sent directly from one CPN to one or multiple other CPN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CPN should support bookmarks (e.g. hyperlinks) to stored and streaming user-generated content in order to store and exchange references to uploaded and streaming UGC,.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The user should be able to personalize bookmarks to UGC.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CPN should support inter-destination content synchronisation of streaming multimedia content. This should achieve that all or a specific group of users consuming specific content get the content presented simultaneously, i.e. without user-noticeable delay difference.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG and the CPN shall support adequate Quality of Service mechanisms (e.g. prioritize the traffic in the event that there is not sufficient bandwidth in the customer network in order to ensure the correct network performances to each traffic flow). To achieve this objective a number of functionalities shall be supported by CNG and/or CNDs, as defined in the following bullets. Most of the following set of requirements is defined adopting as a reference the Home Gateway Initiative (HGI) Release 1 Specification mentioned in clause 2 [6].
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The NGN network QoS functions shall be possible to use to enhance the end-user experience.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may interact with the Resource and Admission Control Subsystem (RACS) as defined in ES 282 001 [9] to support remote real-time QoS control
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG may interact with network elements inside the CPN to support QoS control inside the CPN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall classify packets entering the CPN through its WAN interface (downstream direction) according to a number of predefined priorities. Classification can be done on the basis of different layer 2 and/or layer 3 parameters.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The number of possible values defining the packet priority and, by consequence, the number of queues managed in the downstream direction shall be coherent with the number of concurrent services (data, communication, entertainment) to be treated and supported.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When forwarding packets from the WAN interface to the customer network, the CNG shall perform one of the following three actions, depending on the classification results: manage a number of queues corresponding to the different priorities detected in the classification phase for each packet processed, send the packets to some internal buffers or simply drop the packet.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall classify packets coming from the CPN through its LAN interfaces (upstream direction) according to a number of predefined priorities. Classification can be done on the basis of different layer 2 and/or layer 3 parameters.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The number of possible values defining the packet priority and, by consequence, the number of queues managed in the upstream direction shall be coherent with the number of concurrent services (data, communication, entertainment) to be treated and supported.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When forwarding packets from the customer network to the WAN interface, the CNG shall manage a number of queues corresponding to the different priorities detected in the classification phase for each packet processed.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall be able to classify intra-LAN traffic that is simply bridged by the CNG itself within the CPN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Traffic marking: depending on what are the parameters used to perform classification, CNDs or CNG itself on behalf of the CNDs shall be able to modify the packets' priority.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of huge amount of traffic in upstream or downstream directions, a congestion management mechanism shall be implemented in the CNG to minimize the impact from the user experience point of view.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of managed services, QoS rules applied by CNG shall be configurable by a remote management system.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of unmanaged services, user shall be able to access a QoS configuration function implemented in the CNG.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CNG shall be equipped with an application client to be remotely manageable by the service providers for configuration, monitoring, firmware upgrade purposes. A single parameter can be modified by a single client only.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: It shall be possible to configure the CNG (e.g. firmware downloading) according to the subscribed services. RequirementText: A CPN user shall be able to configure any unmanaged service provided to the user.
