RequirementText: The number of possible values defining the packet priority and, by consequence, the number of queues managed in the upstream direction shall be coherent with the number of concurrent services (data, communication, entertainment) to be treated and supported.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When forwarding packets from the customer network to the WAN interface, the CNG shall manage a number of queues corresponding to the different priorities detected in the classification phase for each packet processed.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CNG shall be able to classify intra-LAN traffic that is simply bridged by the CNG itself within the CPN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Traffic marking: depending on what are the parameters used to perform classification, CNDs or CNG itself on behalf of the CNDs shall be able to modify the packets' priority.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of huge amount of traffic in upstream or downstream directions, a congestion management mechanism shall be implemented in the CNG to minimize the impact from the user experience point of view.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of managed services, QoS rules applied by CNG shall be configurable by a remote management system
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of unmanaged services, user shall be able to access a QoS configuration function implemented in the CNG.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall be equipped with an application client to be remotely manageable by the service providers for configuration, monitoring, firmware upgrade purposes. In case of multiple service providers multiple clients configuring different sets of parameters (for example referring to different services) may be present. A single parameter can be modified by a single client only.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: It shall be possible to configure the CNG (e.g. firmware downloading) according to the subscribed services. This operation may be performed when the CNG is connected to the network for the first time, for each new service subscription/modification, or for any technical management (e.g. security, patches, etc.).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall support mechanisms for secure authentication and communication with the remote management system.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG shall be associated with a unique Hardware ID to be used for identification NGN side.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In case of managed services, the CNG shall support zero-touch provisioning to activate new services, starting from Internet access to voice and video services and shall be remotely manageable. In case of unmanaged services the user shall be able to configure the CNG by himself.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CNG Remote Management requires to manage a specific set of parameters. At least the following list of parameters shall be available: Customer Identification, Physical Line Identification, list of subscribed services, CNG IP address.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: For the CNG management it is recommended to use a single protocol, so as to minimize the complexity and the cost of the service.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CNDs connected to the CPN and devoted to specific managed services shall be remotely manageable
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: (e.g. VoIP phones, Video phones, STBs, etc).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: CNG shall support mechanisms allowing the CNDs remote management when applicable.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Protection mechanisms shall be implemented to avoid that a management client could access and modify parameters that is not allow to configure.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CPN (trough CNDs and/or CNG) shall support manual configuration to insert information to access IMS network (e.g. IMPU, IMPI, Shared keys, Home Network Domain or P-CSCF IP Address, etc.).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CND directly or through the CNG must be able to access to Network Configuration Service Function avoiding any user interaction. (and so the Network Configuration Server should be able to upload different parameter related to service subscription).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CND should be able to support bootstrap capabilities in order to retrieve network configuration data to connect the NGN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CND/CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the user to manually modify the association between a public identity (e.g. phone number) and a specific private identity corresponding to a single customer device not provided with a UICC.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CPN (CND and/or CNG) shall support a method to access a Self Configuration Server.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: All applications under the GlobalPlatform shall be implemented in a hardware-neutral secure runtime environment
Label: Security

RequirementText: The run time environment shall be responsible to separate secure storage for the application code and data
Label: Security

RequirementText: The run time environment shall responsible to establish communication services  between card and off-card entities
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Security domain shall ensure complete seperation of keys among the card issuers and other application providers
Label: Security

RequirementText: "Security Domains shall support security services such as key handling, encryption, decryption, digital signature generation and verification for their providers' such as card issuer, applicaiton providers and controlling authority"
Label: Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform Environment(OPEN) shall responsible for to provide an API to applications,command dispatch, Application selection, (optional) logical channel management, and Card Content management
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall responsible to load application code, card content and memory management
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall responsible to enforce security principles defined for Card Content management.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall own the GlobalPlatform register that contains information for managing the card, Executable Load Files,Applications, Security Domain associations, and privileges.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform API shall provides services to the application such as card verification and security services
Label: Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform API shall provides services  to the card content management such as  card locking and application life cycle state update
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The primary goal of the GlobalPlatform is to ensure the security and integrity of the card's components for the life of the card. These components are The runtime environment,The OPEN,The Issuer Security Domain,Supplementary Security Domains, The Applications.
Label: Security

RequirementText: To ensure card security and integrity, the GlobalPlatform is designed to support a range of secure mechanisms for: Data integrity, Resource availability, Confidentiality, Authentication.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Card Issuer is responsible for Generating and loading the Issuer Security Domain keys,
Label: Security

RequirementText: "The Card Issuer is responsible for Enforcing standards and policies for Application Providers governing all aspects of Applications to be provided to the Card Issuer or operated on the Card Issuer's cards,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: "The Card Issuer is responsible for Working with Application Providers to create and initialize Security Domains other than the Issuer Security Domain,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The Card Issuer is responsible for Determining policy with regards to card and Application Life Cycle management, velocity checking levels, privileges, and other security parameters,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Card Issuer is responsible for Managing the application code loading and installing both on a Pre-Issuance and Post-Issuance basis
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Card Issuer is responsible for Cryptographically authorizing load, install, and extradition to be performed by Application Providers.
Label: Security

RequirementText: "The Application Provider is responsible for Generating the keys for its own Security Domains or obtaining Security Domain keys from a trusted third party,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Application Provider is responsible for Working with the Card Issuer to load generated keys into the Application Provider's Security Domain,
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Application Provider is responsible for Providing applications that meet the Card Issuer's security standards and policies,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The Application Provider is responsible for Providing load file data block signatures according to its own security policy for integrity and source authenticity,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Application Provider is responsible for Obtaining pre-authorization for load, install, and extradition from the Card Issuer,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Application Provider is responsible for Returning receipts for load, install, delete, and extradition, according to the Card Issuer's policy.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "A Controlling Authority is responsible for Generating the keys for its own Security Domain or obtaining Security Domain keys from a trusted third party,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: A Controlling Authority is responsible for Working with the Card Issuer to load generated keys into the Controlling Authority's Security Domain,
Label: Security

RequirementText: "A Controlling Authority is responsible for Providing load file data block signatures according to its own security policy for integrity and source authenticity."
Label: Security

RequirementText: "The runtime environment is responsible for Providing an interface to all Applications that ensures that the runtime environment security mechanisms cannot be bypassed, deactivated, corrupted or otherwise circumvented,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: The runtime environment is responsible for Performing secure memory management
Label: Security

RequirementText: "Secure memory management shall ensure that Each application's code and data (including transient session data) as well as the runtime environment itself and its data (including transient session data) is protected from unauthorized access from within the card,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: "Secure memory management shall ensure that When more than one logical channel is supported, each concurrently selected Application's code and data (including transient session data) as well as the runtime environment itself and its data (including transient session data) is protected from unauthorized access from within the card,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: Secure memory management shall ensure that The previous contents of the memory is not accessible when that memory is reused,
Label: Security

RequirementText: "Secure memory management shall ensure that The memory recovery process is secure and consistent in case of a loss of power or withdrawal of the card from the card reader while an operation is in progress,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: "The runtime environment is responsible for Providing communication services with off-card entities that ensures the proper transmission (according to the specific communication protocol rules) of unaltered command and response messages."
Label: Security

RequirementText: Each Trusted Framework present on the card shall Check the application access rules of the inter-acting Applications according to their respective privileges,
Label: Security

RequirementText: "Each Trusted Framework present on the card shall Enforce the Trusted Framework security rules for inter-application communication, including the rules, defined in appendix G,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: Each Trusted Framework present on the card shall Ensure that incoming messages are properly routed unaltered to their intended destinations,
Label: Security

RequirementText: "Each Trusted Framework present on the card shall Ensure that any response messages are properly returned unaltered (except for any cryptographic protection) to the original receiver of the incoming message."
Label: Security

RequirementText: "The OPEN shall Provide an interface to all Applications that ensures that the GlobalPlatform security mechanism cannot be bypassed, deactivated, corrupted or otherwise circumvented,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall Check application access rules according to the Applications' privileges,
Label: Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall Manage card and Application Life Cycle
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall Ensure that the Card Content changes are authorized by the Card Issuer,
Label: Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall Ensure that application code has been signed by the Controlling Authority represented on the card,
Label: Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall Ensure that application code has been signed by Application Providers represented on the card, if required.
Label: Security

RequirementText: Security Domains enforce the security policies of their off-card Security Domain Provider.
Label: Security

RequirementText: "When applicable a Security Domain shall Communicate with off-card entities in accordance with its Security Domain Provider's security policy in Pre-Issuance and Post-Issuance,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: When applicable a Security Domain shall Manage on-card data securely,
Label: Security

RequirementText: "When applicable a Security Domain shall Provide cryptographic protection services for its own Applications during their personalization and optionally during their subsequent operation,"
Label: Security

RequirementText: When applicable a Security Domain shall Request the OPEN to load, install, extradite, and delete card content,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When applicable a Security Domain shall Return to the off-card entity any receipt for load, install, extradition, and delete,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When applicable a Security Domain shall Verify the authorization for Card Content changes initiated by an off-card authority,
Label: Security

RequirementText: When applicable a Security Domain shall Generate receipts for load, install, extradition, and delete,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When applicable a Security Domain shall Verify the load file data block signature when requested by the OPEN.
Label: Security

RequirementText: A Global Services Application shall Be able to provide services to other Applications, such as CVM services,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A Global Services Application shall Hold the Global Services application-related data securely,
Label: Security

RequirementText: A Global Services Application shall Perform internal security measures as required by the service.
Label: Security

RequirementText: Applications should Expose only data and resources that are necessary for proper application functionality
Label: Security

RequirementText: Applications should Perform internal security measures required by the Application Provider
Label: Security

RequirementText: The back-end systems (multiple back-end systems may exist for a single card), which communicate with the cards, perform the verifications, and manage the off-card key databases, also shall be trusted.
Label: Security

RequirementText: "One of the major requirements for a GlobalPlatform card is the ability to provide a minimum level of cryptographic functionality. This cryptography is, for example, used for the generation of signatures, and is available for use by the Applications present on the card."
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Issuer Security Domain shall implement one Secure Channel Protocol.
Label: Security

RequirementText: A Security Domain other than the Issuer Security Domain shall implement [at least] one Secure Channel Protocol.
Label: Security

RequirementText: A GlobalPlatform card should support symmetric cryptography such as the Data Encryption Standard (DES) algorithm.
Label: Security

RequirementText: A GlobalPlatform card may also support asymmetric cryptography such as the Rivest / Shamir / Adleman (RSA) algorithm.
Label: Security

RequirementText: When present, services to encrypt and decrypt any pattern of data using these algorithms shall be available to Applications.
Label: Security

RequirementText: "It is the responsibility of the Card Issuer or the Controlling Authority to set up the appropriate off-card procedures to comply with the governmental restrictions upon cryptography. Features to disable or restrict cryptography usage by Applications on a card are beyond the scope of this Specification."
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Load File Data Block Hash is intended to verify the integrity of a complete Load File Data Block when loaded to a GlobalPlatform card.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Load File Data Block Hash is used in the computation of The Load File Data Block Signature
Label: Security

RequirementText: The Load File Data Block Hash is used in the computation of The Load Token
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: When present during the loading of a Load File to the card, each signature shall be verified by the appropriate Security Domain.
Label: Security

RequirementText: Tokens shall be verified by the appropriate Security Domain.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The appropriate Security Domain may generate Receipts during Delegated Management.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A GlobalPlatform card may provide security services related to information exchanged between the card and an offcard entity.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The security level of the communication with an off-card entity does not necessarily apply to each individual message being transmitted but can only apply to the environment and/or context in which messages are transmitted.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The concept of the Life Cycle of the card (see section 5.1 - Card Life Cycle) may be used to determine the security level of the communication between the card and an off-card entity.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A GlobalPlatform card offers Entity authentication - in which the card or the off-card entity proves its authenticity to the other entity through a cryptographic exchange,
Label: Security

RequirementText: A GlobalPlatform card offers Integrity and authentication - in which the receiving entity (the card or off-card entity) ensures that the data being received from the sending entity (respectively the off-card entity or card) actually came from an authenticated entity in the correct sequence and has not been altered,
Label: Security

RequirementText: A GlobalPlatform card offers Confidentiality - in which data being transmitted from the sending entity (the off-card entity or card) to the receiving entity (respectively the card or off-card entity) is not viewable by an unauthenticated entity.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The life cycle models is responsible to functionality and security of Card, Executable Load Files, Executable Modules, Security Domains, and Applications.
Label: Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall owns and maintains the Life Cycle information within the GlobalPlatform Registry
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall be responsible to maintain security and administration of the card and its content
Label: Security

RequirementText: At OP_READY state, the OPEN shall be available and ready for execution
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At OP_READY state, the runtime environment shall be  ready for execution
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At OP_READY state, issuer security domain shall be implicitly selected application for all card interfaces
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At OP_READY state,Executable Load Files that were included in Immutable Persistent Memory shall be registered in the GlobalPlatform Registry
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At OP_READY, initial key shall be available within the issuer security domain
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The off-card entity under the OP_READY state may insert Security Domain keys  in order to maintain a cryptographic key separation from the Issuer Security Domain keys
Label: Security

RequirementText: The SECURED state may be used to enforce the relevant security policies of the security domain and applications
Label: Security

RequirementText: The off-card entity under the SECURE state shall be used to ensure the availability of all keys by the issuer security domain
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CARD_LOCKED state shall has the ability to disable the selected security domain and application
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The card under CARD_LOCKED state shall only allow the application to select the final application privilege
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Card Content changes including any type of data management (specifically Security Domain keys and data) shall not allowed in the CARD_LOCKED state.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The state TERMINATED shall be used to permanently disable all card functionality with respect to any card content management and any life cycle changes.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports Command Dispatch functions (Application and Security Domain selection, (Optional) Logical channel management, Command dispatching) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports Card Content Management functions (Content verification, Content loading, Content installation, Content removal, Access control rules for card content management) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports Security Management functions (Security Domain locking and unlocking, Application locking and unlocking, Card locking and unlocking, Card termination, Privilege usage, Security Domain, privilege usage, Tracing and event logging) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports GlobalPlatform Trusted Framework functions (Secure inter-application communication) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The GlobalPlatform Registry is a data store required to support the various system functions of the GlobalPlatform.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Applications and Security Domains may access andor modify some content known or managed by the OPEN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The commands received by a GlobalPlatform card shall be processed by the OPEN or dispatched to the selected Application for processing.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The SELECT [by name] command is processed by the OPEN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card is aware of logical channels but only supports the Basic Logical Channel, the OPEN shall respond with the appropriate error,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card is aware of logical channels and supports at least one Supplementary Logical Channel, the OPEN shall process the command,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card only supports the Basic Logical Channel and has no concept of logical channel support, the command shall be dispatched to the selected Application for processing.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Any other type of command received shall be dispatched to the currently selected Application.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "Commands are either received on the Basic Logical Channel (logical channel number zero) or on a Supplementary Logical Channel (logical channel number other than zero). In compliance with ISO/IEC 7816-4, logical channel information shall be indicated in the class byte of the APDU command header."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "For all commands, if the command indicates a Supplementary Logical Channel that is not opened then:   If the card only supports the Basic Logical Channel and has no concept of logical channel support, the command shall be dispatched to the selected Application for processing.   If the card is aware of logical channels, the OPEN shall respond with the appropriate error. (This requirement may exclude the SELECT command, if the card supports opening of a logical channel using the SELECT command.)"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: For commands that are dispatched to an Application, it is the responsibility of the Application to correctly reject commands that it does not recognize, expect or cannot process.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Issuer Security Domain shall have no multi-selection restrictions on cards that support multiple logical channels i.e. it shall be capable of being selected across multiple logical channels.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Issuer Security Domain is by default the implicitly selectable Application on all logical channels of all card I/O interfaces supported by the card. Implicit selection on a specific logical channel of a specific card I/O interface may be assigned only if the Issuer Security Domain is the implicitly selectable Application on that logical channel of that card I/O interface and no other Locked Application is registered as implicitly selectable for the same logical channel and card I/O interface
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: An Application installed or made selectable with a specific Implicit Selection parameter is registered in the GlobalPlatform Registry as the implicitly selectable Application on the logical channel(s) of the card I/O interface(s) indicated in the parameter if no other Application (other than the Issuer Security Domain) is already registered as implicitly selectable on that logical channel(s) of that card I/O interface(s),
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: An Application installed or made selectable with the Card Reset privilege and no Implicit Selection parameter is registered in the GlobalPlatform Registry as the implicitly selectable Application on the Basic Logical Channel for all card I/O interfaces supported by the card if no other Application (other than the Issuer Security Domain) is already registered as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel of any card I/O interface,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If an Application implicitly selectable on specific logical channel(s) of specific card I/O interface(s) is deleted, the Issuer Security Domain becomes the implicitly selectable Application on that logical channel(s) of that card I/O interface(s).
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The OPEN shall use the implicit selection registration of each Application for controlling the following runtime behavioral requirements:   Identifying the Application which is implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel of the current card I/O interface during the card reset or activation sequence,   Identifying the Application which is implicitly selectable when opening on the current card I/O interface a new Supplementary Logical Channel from the Basic Logical Channel."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The Basic Logical Channel is the permanently available interface to a GlobalPlatform card and shall be supported by the OPEN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall support Application selection on the Basic Logical Channel via Implicit Selection following the card reset (see ISO/IEC 7816-3 for contact cards) or activation sequence (see ISO/IEC 14443-3 for contactless cards),
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN shall support Application selection on the Basic Logical Channel via Explicit Selection through the SELECT [by name] command.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN may also support additional selection processes.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Partial AID selection as defined in section 6.4.2.1.2 - Explicit Selection, shall be supported. (Partial AID selection does not require knowledge of the full AID by the off-card entity.)
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: As multiple Applications on the card may have the same partial AID, it is required that a method exists to select all Applications matching the partial AID.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Once the card session has been established (for contact cards according to ISO/IEC 7816-4 after Answer-to-Reset, or after the activation sequence for contactless cards according to ISO/IEC 14443-3), and before the first command is issued to the card, the Application defined as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel and for that card I/O interface shall become the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel for that card I/O interface.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED, the Application with the Final Application privilege is the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel and the OPEN shall not attempt to identify the implicitly selectable Application
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In all other cases the OPEN shall search the GlobalPlatform Registry for an Application that is marked as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel for the current card I/O interface (e.g. contact or contactless), and if this Application is not in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, it shall become the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel. If this is an Application in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, the Application with the Final Application privilege shall become the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At any time during a Card Session the OPEN may receive a request to select an Application on the Basic Logical Channel (SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command). The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches an entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At any time during a Card Session that has already contained a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command, the OPEN may receive a request to select a next Application (SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command) on the Basic Logical Channel. The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches another entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "For both the SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command and the SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command, an Application becomes the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel if:   The requested AID matches (fully or partially) the Application’s AID,   The Application being selected is in the correct Life Cycle State,   The Application has no restrictions due to multi-selection, and supports the current card interface."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "In the card Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED: - If the Application being selected has the Final Application privilege, this Application is re-selected and a warning is returned to the off-card entity, - If any other Application is being selected, the Application with the Final Application privilege remains selected and an error is returned to the off- card entity,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] or SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received and the data field of the command message is not present, the Issuer Security Domain shall become the currently selected Application and the SELECT command is dispatched to the Issuer Security Domain,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the start of the GlobalPlatform Registry,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the entry following the currently selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel in the GlobalPlatform Registry,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State INSTALLED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. In the eventuality that this locked Application is already currently selected on the Basic Logical Channel, the OPEN shall terminate this Application Session. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application cannot be selected due to a multi-selection restriction or because the Application refuses selection (e.g. because it does not support the current card interface), continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is selectable (i.e. in the correct Life Cycle State and has no multi-selection restrictions), then it shall become the currently selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel and the SELECT [by name] command, whether [first or only occurrence] or [next occurrence], shall be processed according to the requirements of the runtime environment (e.g. dispatched to the Application),
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "If no full or partial match is found at all, the currently selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel shall remain the selected Application and - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [first or only occurrence] parameter set, the SELECT command is dispatched to the Application, - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [next occurrence] parameter set, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: In the eventuality that the current Application Session has been terminated and no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall make an attempt to select the Application that is marked as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel for the current card interface.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At any time during a Card Session the OPEN may receive a request on the Basic Logical Channel to either open or close a Supplementary Logical Channel.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card only supports the Basic Logical Channel and has no concept of logical channel support, the MANAGE CHANNEL command is dispatched to the currently selected Application. In this case, when a Security Domain is the currently selected Application, the command shall be rejected.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "On cards that support logical channels, if a MANAGE CHANNEL [open] is received:   If an Application is designated as implicitly selectable on the new Supplementary Logical Channel for the current card interface, that Application is implicitly selected on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel and runtime behavior requirements apply,   Otherwise the Application designated as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel for this card interface is implicitly selected on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel and runtime behavior requirements apply."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: On cards that support logical channels, if a MANAGE CHANNEL [close] is received, terminate the Application Session currently selected on the Supplementary Logical Channel indicated by the command and then close that logical channel. The Basic Logical Channel can never be closed.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED, return the appropriate error.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the number of logical channels supported by the OPEN is not sufficient to open a new Supplementary Logical Channel, return the appropriate error.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The OPEN shall search the GlobalPlatform Registry for the Application that supports the current card interface and that is marked as implicitly selectable on the new Supplementary Logical Channel (or failing that, on the Basic Logical Channel) and: - If this is an Application in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, the Application with the Final Application privilege shall become the selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel, - If this Application cannot be selected due to a multi-selection restriction, the new logical channel shall not be opened and the OPEN shall return the appropriate error, - Otherwise, the Supplementary Logical Channel is opened and this Application shall become the selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Once an Application becomes the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel, the responsibility for subsequent command dispatching still rests with the OPEN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: On cards that are aware of logical channels, the MANAGE CHANNEL commands are only processed by the OPEN and are not dispatched to an Application.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: All other commands (including the MANAGE CHANNEL commands on cards that are not aware of logical channels or SELECT commands not described in section 6.4.2.1.2 - Explicit Selection) are immediately dispatched to the Application currently selected on the Basic Logical Channel. The processing of the command by the Application is beyond the scope of this Specification.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The OPEN shall support Application selection on an available Supplementary Logical Channel via two processes:   Implicit Selection following a successful MANAGE CHANNEL [open] command,   Explicit Selection through the SELECT [by name] command."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The OPEN may also support additional selection processes.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Partial AID selection as defined in section 6.4.3.1.2 - Explicit Selection, shall be supported on Supplementary Logical Channels.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At any time on an open Supplementary Logical Channel, the OPEN may receive a request to select an Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel (SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command). The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches an entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: At any time on an open Supplementary Logical Channel that has already contained a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command since the Supplementary Logical Channel was last opened, the OPEN may receive a request to select a next Application (SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command) on this Supplementary Logical Channel. The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches another entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "For both the SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command and the SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command, an Application becomes the selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel if:   The requested AID matches (fully or partially) the Application’s AID,   The Application being selected is in the correct Life Cycle State,   The Application has no restrictions due to multi-selection, and supports the current card interface."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED: - Close the Supplementary Logical Channel, if currently open, - Return the appropriate error,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] or SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received and the data field of the command message is not present, the Issuer Security Domain shall become the currently selected Application and the SELECT command is dispatched to the Issuer Security Domain,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the start of the GlobalPlatform Registry,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the entry following the currently selected Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel in the GlobalPlatform Registry,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State INSTALLED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. In the eventuality that this locked Application is already currently selected on the same Supplementary Logical Channel, the OPEN shall terminate this Application Session. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "If a full or partial match is found and this Application cannot be selected due to a multi-selection restriction or because the Application refuses selection (e.g. because it does not support the current card interface), continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,"
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is selectable (i.e. in the correct Life Cycle State and has no multi-selection restrictions), then it shall become the currently selected Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel and the SELECT [by name] command, whether [first or only occurrence] or [next occurrence], shall be processed according to the requirements of the runtime environment (e.g. dispatched to the Application),
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "If no full or partial match is found at all, the currently selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel shall remain the selected Application and - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [first or only occurrence] parameter set, the SELECT command is dispatched to the Application, - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [next occurrence] parameter set, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "At any time on an open Supplementary Logical Channel the OPEN may receive a request to either open or close a Supplementary Logical Channel. If a MANAGE CHANNEL [open] is received and the Application selected on the original Supplementary Logical Channel has no multi-selection restrictions, this Application becomes the selected Application on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel. If a MANAGE CHANNEL [close] is received, terminate the Application Session currently selected on the Supplementary Logical Channel indicated by the command and then close that logical channel. The Basic Logical Channel can never be closed."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED, return the appropriate error,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the number of logical channels supported by the OPEN is not sufficient to open a new Supplementary Logical Channel, return the appropriate error,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the Application currently selected on the original Supplementary Logical Channel cannot be selected on the new Supplementary Logical Channel due to a multi-selection restriction, the new logical channel shall not be opened and the OPEN shall return the appropriate error,
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Otherwise, the Supplementary Logical Channel indicated by the command is opened and the Application currently selected on the original Supplementary Logical Channel shall become the selected Application on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Once an Application becomes the selected Application on a Supplementary Logical Channel, the responsibility for subsequent command dispatching still rests with the OPEN.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The MANAGE CHANNEL commands are only processed by the OPEN and are not dispatched to an Application.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: All other commands (including SELECT commands not described in section 6.4.3.1.2 - Explicit Selection) are immediately dispatched to the Application currently selected on the Supplementary Logical Channel. The processing of the command by the Application is beyond the scope of this Specification.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The GlobalPlatform Registry is used to:   Store card management information,   Store relevant application management information (e.g., AID, associated Security Domain and Privileges),   Support card resource management data,   Store Application Life Cycle information,   Store card Life Cycle information,   Track any counters associated with logs."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: "The contents of the GlobalPlatform Registry may be updated in response to:   An internal OPEN invoked action,   An authorized Application invoked action."
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: All Applications including all Security Domains, and all Executable Load Files, shall have an entry in the GlobalPlatform Registry.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Each Executable Load File or Executable Module is associated with an AID that shall be unique on the card.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: An Application AID may be the same as that of an Executable Module but may not be the same as that of an Executable Load File or the same as another Application already present in the GlobalPlatform Registry.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: This AID may be specified in a SELECT command to select the Application. It is not possible to select Executable Load Files or Executable Modules.
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Successful authentication is a prerequisite for the processing of any on-line or offline CEPS transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: On-line authentication must take place between the card issuer and the CEP card for load, unload, and currency exchange transactions
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card issuer and the CEP card share a secret key to generate and verify MACs
Label: Security

RequirementText: Off-line authentication must take place between a PSAM in the POS device and the CEP card for purchase and cancel last purchase transactions
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card and the PSAM must use a public key algorithm for mutual authentication and session key exchange, as no permanent shared secret key may exist between the CEP card and the PSAM
Label: Security

RequirementText: To load value into a slot of the CEP card securely, the load device establishes a connection between the issuer and the CEP card
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card should use a unique diversified secret key, personalized into the card, to generate and authenticate transaction signatures
Label: Security

RequirementText: If this is not a cash load, the funds issuer needs to verify that the funds are requested by the legitimate account owner, which is normally done by the presentation of an enciphered PIN
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card issuer needs to ensure that the load acquirer is guaranteeing payment for the electronic value, and that the card is authentic
Label: Security

RequirementText: The load acquirer needs to ensure that the issuer is the true owner of the card, and, in the case of an apparent failure of the load, the load acquirer needs the card presented to authenticate the failure
Label: Security

RequirementText: The load device sends S1 in an authorization request to the issuer
Label: Security

RequirementText: The load device also provides for verification of the identity of the cardholder (with either on-line or off-line PIN verification) and forwards verification data in the authorization request
Label: Security

RequirementText: The issuer validates S1 to authenticate the card and the data to be used in the transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: The issuer sends S2 to the load acquirer in the authorization response message
Label: Security

RequirementText: Unloads are permitted only to an account controlled by the card issuer and are performed only at a load device under the control of the card issuer
Label: Security

RequirementText: The cardholder must have an account relationship with the card issuer, and funds removed from the card are credited to the cardholder account only after the card issuer authenticates the card
Label: Security

RequirementText: The issuer needs only to authenticate the card, and the card needs only to authenticate the issuer and that the data is the same as used by the issuer
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card generates S1, using data from the card and load device, and sends S1 to the card issuer to authenticate the card and the data that is to be used in the transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card issuer generates S2, which is sent to the card to allow the card to validate the card issuerƒ??s authenticity and to ensure that the data used by the card in the transaction is the same as the card issuer intended
Label: Security

RequirementText: In the case of an unsuccessful completion, exception processing outlined in the On-line Exception Processing section is performed
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: During a purchase transaction, the CEP card must ensure that it is dealing with an authentic POS device, and it must generate a signature to allow the card issuer to verify the integrity of the transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: The POS device must ensure that it is dealing with an authentic card, and guarantee integrity of transactions and batches to the merchant acquirer
Label: Security

RequirementText: In the case of a reversal, the CEP card must re-authenticate the PSAM
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card must ensure that the transaction is performed by the same POS device as was used for the purchase being canceled, and that the amount of the cancellation is the same as the amount of the purchase, or, in the case of an incremental purchase, the same as the amount of the last step
Label: Security

RequirementText: During a Cancel Last Purchase transaction, the CEP card is authenticated by the PSAM in the POS device
Label: Security

RequirementText: The PSAM authenticates that the purchase transaction being canceled was performed by the PSAM, and that the transaction being canceled is part of the active batch
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card issuer and the merchant acquirer also authenticate the transaction when they receive it
Label: Security

RequirementText: Transmissions between host systems should be protected by MACs based on unique keys that are shared by the nodes involved
Label: Security

RequirementText: The transaction signatures ensure end to end integrity of transmitted data for load, unload, and currency exchange transactions
Label: Security

RequirementText: These totals are used by the merchant acquirer to ensure the integrity of the batch
Label: Security

RequirementText: The count and amount of the transactions in the batch must be protected by the S4 MAC,  This information is not part of the card issuerƒ??s verification process
Label: Security

RequirementText: Scheme providers must assign unique identifying numbers to merchant acquirers who provide PSAMs
Label: Security

RequirementText: These merchant acquirers must then assign unique identifiers to PSAMs
Label: Security

RequirementText: Each PSAM must maintain a transaction count, The unique PSAM ID and the transaction count are used during a conversation with a CEP card. The transaction count must not be reset during the life of the PSAM
Label: Security

RequirementText: Contain the CA public RSA key, the PSAMƒ??s private RSA key and optionally the certificates that the POS device uses to perform mutual authentication with the CEP card
Label: Security

RequirementText: Perform the calculation required to generate a signature using the PSAMƒ??s private RSA key, to allow the CEP card to validate the PSAM
Label: Security

RequirementText: Contain the latest transaction count and amount of batches that have not been deleted from the POS device by the merchant or merchant acquirer
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Contain the details of a transaction between the initialize command for that transaction and the initialize command for the next transaction
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Be the entity that maintains control over the flow of a transaction, ensuring that all security is enforced
Label: Security

RequirementText: Perform the verification of signatures and certificates during a purchase and cancel last purchase transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: Ensure that each batch of transactions is cleared and settled once and only once
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Send transactions to card issuers or their processors in a standard format defined in agreement with the scheme provider
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Ensure that CA public keys, aggregation parameters, blocking lists and issuer certificate revocation lists from the scheme providers are sent to the POS devices
Label: Security

RequirementText: Share one or more MAC keys with connecting processors, create a MAC on each transmission sent to another processor, and verify the MAC on each transmission received from another processor
Label: Security

RequirementText: Send transactions to other processors in a standard format defined in agreement with the scheme provider
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If a supported scheme provider has a dispute resolution process, participate in that dispute resolution process with connecting processors to resolve any issues related to invalid transactions. These resolution processes should include a mechanism for repayment of funds associated with invalid transactions
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The scheme provider must ensure that the entire process between merchants, merchant acquirers, card issuers, and processors is auditable and reconcilable
Label: Security

RequirementText: If errors in the card issuer MAC are discovered by the card issuer during its processing of the transactions, a dispute mechanism, established by the scheme provider, may be used to have money refunded
Label: Security

RequirementText: If a scheme provider establishes a central error repository, all transactions for the scheme with MAC errors must be sent to that central error repository whether or not they are submitted to the dispute process
Label: Security

RequirementText: Payment for a transaction is only required when a detail transaction is submitted for payment, A merchant acquirer may choose to pay the merchant using the batch total
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The timing of payment to the merchant must be established between the merchant and the merchant acquirer
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A purchase transaction may be reversed, prior to the removal of the CEP card from the POS device, by sending a purchase reversal command to the CEP card, The CEP card must authenticate the PSAM using certificates previously exchanged
Label: Security

RequirementText: The amount to be reversed is the amount of the last step of the transaction. The reversal command sent to the CEP card contains a S2 MAC computed by the PSAM
Label: Security

RequirementText: The PSAM in the POS device generates a merchant acquirer S5 MAC for the transaction, computes a new S4 MAC on the updated batch total count and amount, and logs the transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CEP card authenticates the PSAM using the certificates previously received and the S2, The CEP card increments the value of the purse and logs the transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CEP card sends a response to the reversal command to the POS device. The reversal is considered to be successful even in the event of a negative response or no response from the CEP card
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: After the CEP card is inserted in the POS device, the POS device initiates the cancel last purchase transaction
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the POS device supports multiple applications or multiple transaction types, an interaction between the terminal and consumer or sales agent determines the CEP application and the function to be performed (cancel last purchase transaction)
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CEP card verifies that the PSAM is the PSAM used in the original transaction, computes a S1 MAC using the same DES session key that was used for the purchase transaction being cancelled, and responds to the POS device with the S1 and the identification of the last transaction. If the purchase transaction to be canceled has been canceled or is not part of the active batch, the command is not allowed
Label: Security

RequirementText: The PSAM either retrieves or re-derives the DES session key used for the purchase transaction being cancelled. The POS device authenticates the CEP card using this key and the S1 MAC
Label: Security

RequirementText: The PSAM in the POS device generates a merchant acquirer S5 MAC for the transaction and a new S4 MAC for the batch total count and amount and logs the transaction. The amount of the canceled last purchase transaction is subtracted from the header amount. The transaction is kept in a data store associated with the POS device until the merchant acquirer collects it
Label: Security

RequirementText: A credit command, which contains the S2 MAC computed by the PSAM using the session key, is sent to the CEP card
Label: Security

RequirementText: The CEP card authenticates the terminal using the S2 MAC and the session key from the purchase transaction being cancelled. The CEP card increments the value of the purse and logs the transaction. The CEP card verifies that the cancellation amount is equal to the amount of the last step of the purchase transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: A transaction collection process must exist. Data being transmitted from the POS devices must be transmitted in a manner that ensures integrity of the data
Label: Security

RequirementText: The batch is sent to the merchant acquirer. Delivery may involve transmission to multiple intermediate locations or it may be direct to the merchant acquirer
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The merchant acquirer validates the batch to ensure that it has been transmitted correctly and enters it into the log
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: If the business rules allow this transaction is to be aggregated, the PSAM must determine if it has an aggregation record for the card issuer. If the PSAM does not have an aggregation record for the card issuer, a new aggregation record for the card issuer must be created
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The aggregated totals by card issuer must be transmitted to the merchant acquirer at the same time and manner as the non-aggregated detail transactions in the batch
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Each POS transaction completed at the POS device is given a S5 MAC by the PSAM, which is used by the merchant acquirer to validate that the transactions were made at a POS device with a valid PSAM. The batch total count and amount must be protected by the S4 MAC, which must also be validated by the merchant acquirer
Label: Security

RequirementText: The merchant acquirer validates the PSAMƒ??s MACs prior to accepting the POS transactions for payment. In addition, selected data elements are validated to ensure correct processing by the POS device and its PSAM
Label: Security

RequirementText: Each purchase transaction is signed by the CEP card with a S6 MAC, which is used by the card issuer to validate that the transaction was made with a legitimate, not counterfeit, CEP card. The card issuer validates the CEP cardƒ??s MAC
Label: Security

RequirementText: Payment decisions are based on signature validations, scheme provider rules, and merchant and merchant acquirer agreements
Label: Security

RequirementText: After investigation, if the merchant acquirer decides, based on scheme rules, to accept the transactions, a method must exist to settle them and forward them to the card issuer
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A transaction that passes merchant acquirer validations and is forwarded to the card issuer is paid for by the card issuer. If the transaction does not pass card issuer validations, the card issuer may follow the scheme providerƒ??s dispute procedures
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Pay on detail is the default payment arrangement for merchant acquirers to provide payment to their merchants. In this arrangement, the merchant acquirer relies on the POS transaction S5 MAC to determine acceptance. Merchants are paid only for valid POS transactions
Label: Security

RequirementText: POS transactions that were rejected for payment by the merchant acquirer are flagged with an error code indicating the type of validation failure and are forwarded to the card issuer for CEP card history information only
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: All load transactions are on-line transactions. Authorization of funds for load transactions must require a form of cardholder verification. The load device must support on-line encrypted PIN or off-line PIN verification
Label: Security

RequirementText: Off-line PIN verification must include both encrypted and unencrypted PIN
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card verification method indicator (CVMI) in the CEP card must specify support of online PIN verification and at least one method of off-line PIN verification (encrypted or unencrypted)
Label: Security

RequirementText: Since these transactions are on-line to the issuer, the issuer has the opportunity to lock the card or the application. These transactions are not available to a card that has already been locked
Label: Security

RequirementText: Card issuers must inform their cardholders as to which currencies they support in electronic purses
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Load acquirers must determine the currencies that they must support for load transaction
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CEP application must contain data that indicates the presence of a linked financial institution. If a linked financial institution is established for the CEP application, then linked loads must be allowed and data in the application must indicate whether linked loads are supported
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Flexibility is required to accommodate the variety of environments where unlinked loads may be implemented. As a result, the design specification must not preclude dual-leg transactions** from taking place either sequentially or in parallel. The design of a given implementation will vary depending on the device, host, and network capabilities
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Unload and currency exchange transactions are optional for CEP card issuers. The CEP card must indicate whether the card issuer supports these transactions. However, if a card issuer issues multi-currency capable cards, it must provide its cardholder with a facility to remove any remaining value. As a result, if a card issuer supports loading of multiple currencies onto a card, then it must support the unload or currency exchange transaction or both
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The card issuer must establish its policies for assigning and adjusting slot maximum balances. These policies may require the card issuer to maintain a card database
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Currency exchange rate fluctuations may increase the card issuers liability. The card issuer must be able to adjust maximum balances to bring them in line with their policies. The card issuer may update the maximum balances as part of a load, a partial unload, and a currency exchange transaction. On a currency exchange transaction, only the ƒ??toƒ? currency maximum balance may be updated
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A CEP card may contain currencies that the load acquirer does not support. As a result, load devices must use the alphabetic issuer-supplied currency code and currency exponent from the CEP slot(s) to display the source amounts for the currency conversion transaction
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Card issuers must provide an alphabetic currency code in each message that establishes a new currency. This alphabetic currency code and the currency exponent will be used by the load device to display currency balances. This allows the cardholder to identify the currency being displayed
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Script messages that conform to EMV specifications may be included as part of load, unload and currency exchange messages from the card issuer to the CEP card. An update key must be used when card parameters are changed. Script messages may be sent to the CEP card either before or after the credit for load, debit of unload and currency exchange commands
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: All on-line messages must have the ability to include card issuer discretionary data from the CEP card
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The card issuer must notify the cardholder if the assessment of service fees by the card issuer during the currency exchange transaction may result in a balance of zero after the transaction has completed
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The card issuer must have the ability to deactivate a CEP application in the response to a load or currency exchange transaction
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CEP card may support multiple currencies. Each currency occupies a ƒ??slotƒ? within the CEP. The slots are defined by the currency supported. The currency for an individual slot is determined during load or currency exchange. Currency exchange could apply to a single slot, and then only for the total balance
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: It is a card issuerƒ??s decision to determine the currencies that are allowed to occupy slots in the CEP card. This decision is made by the card issuer during the load or currency exchange transaction, by approving or rejecting the request to authorize the transaction
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: A single currency cannot occupy more than one slot. The CEP card must not permit a slot to be assigned a currency if another slot in the CEP card has already been assigned to that currency
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The CEP card limits each slot to a maximum balance. The maximum balance for a slot is established when a currency is assigned to the slot, and is determined externally by the card issuer or by CEP card data which indicates a maximum balance in a reference currency. There is no requirement that all slot maximums have the same relative value, and there is no requirement for the card to maintain a maximum total value
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Only one version of the CA public key is required in the card. This requires that the PSAMs with which the CEP card exchanges cryptograms must be capable of generating and validating cryptograms using the relevant keys from all current cards
Label: Security

RequirementText: Two-way, or mutual, authentication, where the card authenticates the terminal and the terminal authenticates the card for each transaction, must be performed for off-line transactions
Label: Security

RequirementText: For increased security and convenience, asymmetric cryptography must be used as the authentication security for off-line transactions
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card must authenticate the terminal at the point of sale, ensuring that it is genuine and valid, and use a two-way authentication process
Label: Security

RequirementText: The terminal must authenticate the card and the transaction at the point of sale, ensuring that they are genuine and valid
Label: Security

RequirementText: The terminal must participate in a two-way authentication process with the card
Label: Security

RequirementText: For cancel last purchase transactions, the terminal must validate the card and sign the cancellation
Label: Security

RequirementText: The terminal must secure transactions by retaining the cardƒ??s symmetric MACing key signature as part of the transaction
Label: Security

RequirementText: The terminal must generate a symmetric MACing key signature and send it to the merchant acquirer
Label: Security

RequirementText: Incremental purchase transactions must use two-way authentication for the initial session authentication, and at least one-way, with the terminal authenticating the card, for the remaining increments or some of the remaining increments
Label: Security

RequirementText: Load and unload functions must be authenticated using end-to-end security between the card and the card issuer
Label: Security

RequirementText: The issuer host must authenticate the card upon the load/unload request
Label: Security

RequirementText: The card must authenticate the issuer host upon the response to the request
Label: Security

RequirementText: A proof must be sent to the load acquirer that a load or unload occurred to avoid repudiation
Label: Security

RequirementText: The management of keys must be accomplished in a secure, certified environment
Label: Security

RequirementText: There may be multiple certification authorities that manage keys for the system, including the possibility of one overall highest level certification authority (perhaps on an international level), and domestic certification authorities for each country or region
Label: Security

RequirementText: The system must protect the integrity of key transaction data including transaction identification, currency code and amount. If tampering is suspected, the system must cause the transaction to fail
Label: Security

RequirementText: Expired cards must not be used for loading electronic value
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: The time period during which a cardholder can unload electronic value, perform a purchase or a currency exchange from an expired card may be determined by each issuer
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Consumers must be able to load electronic value to their cards at any participating load device, regardless of the location, provided that the currency that is requested is supported by the acquirer and the card issuer
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Funds issuers must accept funds authorization requests, regardless of the load currency type, as permitted
Label: Security

RequirementText: Load devices that are available to the general public should support multiple sources of funding and support both linked and unlinked loads
Label: Non-Security

RequirementText: Authorizations for load transactions require a form of cardholder authentication for funds requests
Label: Security

RequirementText: The load device must support on-line PIN encryption or off-line PIN verification
Label: Security

RequirementText: The load device which supports only off-line PIN verification must support both the off-line PIN encryption method and the off-line PIN plain text verification method as defined in EMV
Label: Security

RequirementText: Unload transactions do not require cardholder authentication. (However, an acquirerƒ??s devices may be configured such that authentication is required for access.)
Label: Security

RequirementText: The architecture for the electronic purse should not preclude the eventual deployment of a variety of devices to meet the needs of many card acceptance environments. Unload must not be precluded from being supported on any or all of these devices at the option of the acquirer
Label: Non-Security
